# Mega Shoutout [(by TerrierDarts)](https://www.twitch.tv/TerrierDarts)

## Description 
This extension will show a really cool on-screen effect for shout-outs, it can be fully customised to match the asthetics of your stream.
## Tutorials
### Install
<iframe width="1120" height="630" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fwUJjkFvkPI" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

### Editing
<iframe width="1120" height="630" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4vHbx5DAlc4" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

## Import Code and Json File
This import code includes a SB installer, using OBS raw however I have found this to need tweeking on the delays, I've also attached a Json file which includes the scene.
```

```
[**SCENE .JSON File**](/extensions/shoutouts/shoutout.json)

## Set Up
### OBS Plug-Ins
#### Plug-Ins needed for this.
[**Source Copy**](https://obsproject.com/forum/resources/source-copy.1261/)
[**Move Transition**](https://obsproject.com/forum/resources/move-transition.913/)
#### Optional Plug-ins.
[**Gradient**](https://obsproject.com/forum/resources/gradient-source.1172/)
[**OBS ShaderFilter**](https://github.com/Oncorporation/obs-shaderfilter/releases)
> If you have all the plug-ins and you still see nothing, then you will need to re-route the filters file locations to your own file locations. {.is-warning}
### Commands
Once this is all edited and you have it looking how you wish you will just need to tie this to a `!so` command.

There is also a `Sub-Action` that allows you to post these to your Discord if you want to use this you will need to add a file path to the `filePath` Argument Sub-Action, you will also need to add your discord webhook to the `discordWebhook` Sub-Action. If you dont wish to use these features you can disable or delete the actions between the commented `TOP and BOTTOM DISCORD ACTIONS`

### Editing
Editing this can be difficult but if you follow the video above it should make the whole process easier, the things to remember is it that if you change the size of something then there is a chance the move filters will be affected to get everything how you want them to look first then edit the filters. If you dont want to do that you can delete the filters and use OBS Show and Hide Transitions.
